description: Aromatic and flavorful rice layered with tender meat, potatoes, and a blend of exotic spices. Cooked on dum (slow steam) for an unforgettable taste.

ingredients.quantity: a pinch, soaked in 1/4 cup warm milk

steps: Wash and soak the rice for 30 minutes.

Marinate the meat with ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, salt, half of the chopped cilantro, and mint leaves. Marinate for at least 2 hours or preferably overnight.
Heat ghee or oil in a large pot. Fry the sliced onions until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for later.
Add the marinated meat to the pot and cook until the meat is slightly browned. Add tomatoes and green chilies and cook until the tomatoes soften.
Add the cubed potatoes and cook for a few minutes.
Add the soaked rice to the pot. Gently mix without breaking the rice. Add water (about twice the amount of rice) and salt.
Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot tightly, and cook on dum (slow steam) for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.
After cooking, gently fluff the rice with a fork. Sprinkle the saffron-infused milk, remaining fried onions, cilantro, and mint leaves on top.
Cover the pot again and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before serving.
